simulation.language

Class ModuloLanguage

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulation.language.ModuloLanguage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ModuloLanguage>, Language

    public class ModuloLanguage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Language, java.lang.Comparable<ModuloLanguage>
    A class of languages based on modulo congruence relation. A ModuloLanguage object has two parameters: congruency and modulus. A word belongs to this language if its id is congruent modulo modulus to congruency.
    See Also:
    ELCPaperSimulationCreator, Language

        public ModuloLanguage(int modulus,
                      int congruency)
        Initializes this language with the given modulus and congruency parameters. A word belongs to this language if its id is congruent modulo modulus to congruency.
        Parameters:
        modulus - the initial modulus parameter for this language
        congruency - the initial congruency parameter for this language

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(ModuloLanguage o)
        Compares this language with the given ModuloLanguage object. If the modulus parameters are not equal, returns Integer.compare(this.getModulus(), o.getModulus()). Otherwise, returns Integer.compare(this.getCongruency(), o.getCongruency()).
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<ModuloLanguage>
        Parameters:
        o - a language to be compared
        Returns:
        if the modulus parameters are not equal, returns Integer.compare(this.getModulus(), o.getModulus()); otherwise, returns Integer.compare(this.getCongruency(), o.getCongruency())
